moving

Class Shot

  • java.lang.Object
    • moving.Shot

  • public class Shot
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all info/data for a single bullet/shot and updates all information for it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shot

        public Shot(Game myGame,
    int x,
    int y,
    double angle,
    double speed,
    double range,
    double grav,
    int spreadAngle,
    boolean piercesEnemies,
    boolean piercesWalls,
    int[] damageRange,
    boolean friendly,
    boolean melee,
    java.lang.Object referencePoint,
    java.awt.Image shotImage)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        myGame - A copy of the current Game.
        x - The x-location of the shot on the map.
        y - The y-location of the shot on the map.
        damageRange - The shot's damage, represented by an int array of two values (lower bound - upper bound)
        spreadAngle - The error in angle in the shot, in degrees. Each shot has a certain "error" when shooting, which is called the "spread" angle.
        angle - The angle at which the shot is fired.
        speed - The shot's speed in pixels/frame (each frame is 1/60th of a second).
        range - The shot's range in pixels.
        grav - The acceleration downwards of the shot, in pixels/frame (each frame is 1/60th of a second).
        piercesEnemies - Whether this shot pierces enemies (hits multiple enemies or not).
        piercesWalls - Whether this shot pierces walls (can hit multiple blocks or not).
        friendly - Whether it is a friendly bullet or not (friendly bullets, which are the player's bullets, harm enemies only, and vice-versa).
        melee - Whether this is a melee shot (if it's a melee shot then it must follow the Object that holds the melee weapon).
        referencePoint - The reference point which the shot will stick to if this is a melee weapon.
        shotImage - The shot's image.

    • Method Detail

      • drawShot

        Draws the shot.
        Parameters:
        g - The object on which the graphics is drawn.

      • updateShot

        public void updateShot()
        Updates the shot and rotates the image based on its angle.

      • needsToBeRemoved

        public boolean needsToBeRemoved()
        Checks to see if this shot needs to be removed from the "shots" array in the Game class.
        Returns:
        True if this shot needs to be removed, false if not.

      • setRemove

        public void setRemove(boolean nRemove)
        Sets whether the Shot needs to be removed or not.
        Parameters:
        nRemove - The new value for whether the shot should be removed or not.

      • getCoord

        public java.awt.Point getCoord()
        Returns the coordinates of the shot.
        Returns:
        A Point representing the location of the Shot.

      • getDamage

        public int getDamage()
        Returns the damage that the shot does.
        Returns:
        the damage the shot does.
